main event: Arthur F. Norton observed an unusual well-lighted object in Norwood, Ohio on June 6, 1953, around 4:50 a.m.
interesting points: The object was reported to be the size of the moon with a dark center., The observation lasted for about 10-15 minutes., The object did not leave a vapor trail upon disappearance., The observer was somewhat confused and did not fully understand the incident., Only the observer witnessed the event; no other confirmations were noted.
